reviews.review_msg: Leith seems like a cool person and she is quite nice and can give good input. However, the material was often boring! I found analyzing novels much easier than this.

I had to take English for one of my electives and chose to take 104. If English isn't your strong suit, DON'T TAKE THIS COURSE. It revolves around psychoanalysis and Lacan which to me, doesn't scream English at all...Although he seems extremely knowledgeable in the course content, I feel lost, confused, and no better off than when I started.

Refreshing... Definitely helped increase my interest in English as a potential major. Would whole-heartedly recommend him to anyone. Test is/was fairly difficult, but if you've been attending lecture regularly, you should be fine.

Cool prof, very intersting. He may seem scary at times but he's really nice. He has a tendency to go off on a tangent sometimes, & he HATES late people! he will rant about them for like 5 minutes... (per person) but all-in-all he's a good prof. i mean, he can chop cement blocks with his hand! (ask him for a demo) :)

Peter Cramers lectures are extremely boring and he is very monotone. He doesn't seem to like what he's teaching which makes it very dull. Assignments don't make sense. Definitely wouldn't take another class with him ever. Do not recommend.
Class and Prof are ok, Peter's notes are pretty much all you need, the textbooks have too much other info in them. Pretty easy class...
